alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 1:42PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Charles, southwestern Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 215 PM CDT... At 142 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Estelle, or near Marrero, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Avondale, Chalmette, Gretna, Westwego, Jean Lafitte, Woodmere, Terrytown, Lafitte, Bridge City, Estelle, Barataria and Arabi. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 234 and 235. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Western Orleans
